body: @msquaredds Thanks for reporting this issue. I was able to reproduce this. For example, this is the printed version of https://issues.streamlit.app/:

issue.title: First page is blank when printing and sidebar is collapsed

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

If an app has a sidebar that is collapsed and you print it through our "Print" feature in the app menu, the first page of the printout will be blank. 

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import streamlit as st

st.write("Main area")
st.sidebar.write("Sidebar")
```


### Steps To Reproduce

1. Run the app
2. Collapse the sidebar
3. Got to app menu > Print

### Expected Behavior

First page is just the main area of the app, i.e. contains the text "Main area".

### Current Behavior

First page is blank, 2nd page contains the text "Main area". 
![CleanShot 2023-11-14 at 14 35 25](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/assets/5103165/7aef9b28-0a47-4922-9bf3-723af3238ef8)


### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.28.2
- Python version: 3.10
- Operating System: Mac
- Browser: Chrome


### Additional Information

_No response_

body:
Bumping this up to a P2. Note that a similar issue also seems to happen for Single Page App with a sidebar, even when it is collapsed (#7722)

For reference, here's the [earlier PR #6180](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/6180) from @sfc-gh-jgarcia that did some improvements to how this prints. In that PR, it seems like the MPA sidenav is printing above the page text and doesn't create any additional gap. Juan also mentioned in a private conversation that the intended behavior was "if folks want to remove [the sidebar during printing], then you can collapse it from the `<` icon and it won‚Äôt show up".

I wonder if there was a CSS regression since February that created this gap. Might be something to test. I did find at least one case with a longer sidenav it doesn't create an additional gap -> try printing [this app](https://joshua-mpa1-5-sidenav.streamlit.app/). So I wonder if it's some minimal height getting set somewhere or similar.

Seeing these examples, I also wonder how useful the sidebar is to show at all in a printed case? How often does the viewer want to include that in what's printed?

I suspect that in almost all cases, printing the sidebar above the main text is not desired / looks kind of bad even if the spacing is correct (??) and in a portrait mode print there isn't really room for both.

A few ideas on how to proceed:
- Quick fix: just always hide the sidebar / sidenav during printing and start main window content at the top
- Alternate quick fix: If you collapse the sidebar / sidenav, it hides during printing as expected and start main window content at the top (so at least there's always a workaround)
- More involved fix: Print the sidebar / sidenav to the left of the main content if and only if: 1) it's not collapsed on the current page, and 2) the print width is some minimum bigger than portrait (e.g. the default width for landscape)

Personally I'd be OK with just hiding it until / unless we hear use cases where people really need to print with the sidebar. I think in any portrait case, it's going to look bad whether above or beside the main window. cc @jrieke

Thanks Joshua, and agree on P2. I don't really have a strong opinion on how it should print. But I'm 99% sure if we just hide the sidebar, someone will open up a GitHub issue within a few days. üòâ I think your 2nd option (if you collapse it, it doesn't show up in the print) sounds best to me (and is actually what I would expect anyway).

issue.title: Fix blank space print

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes Improve printing of Streamlit apps: - Printing via `Cmd + P` prints the same view as clicking on `Print` on the app menu - When sidebar is open, print it - When sidebar is collapsed, don't print it In Firefox, the print margins should be set to `minimum` or the content should be scaled in order to avoid overflows. Following screenshots show the before and after visualization based on our [Streamlit Issues](https://github.com/streamlit/st-issues) app:
Print with sidebar open
Mode Before After
Portrait Screenshot (Before) Portrait With Sidebar Open (After) Portrait With Sidebar Open
Landscape (Before) Landscape With Sidebar Open (After) Landscape With Sidebar Open
Print with sidebar closed
Mode Before After
Portrait (Before) Portrait With Sidebar Closed (After) Portrait With Sidebar Closed
Landscape (Before) Landscape With Sidebar Closed (After) Landscape With Sidebar Closed
## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable) Closes #7815 ## Testing Plan - Added a print-test by setting the media type to `print` and set the viewport to DIN A4 dimensions. The used `'forced_colors="active"'` argument is supposed to force showing background images similar to the '-webkit-print-color-adjust' CSS property. It looks like for the test that Chromium does not respect this property, so screenshots might look funny from a color-perspective there. --- **Contribution License Agreement** By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.
